main event: A single unidentified object was observed in the sky over Kalamazoo, Michigan on May 12, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed moving from 2 to 30 degrees in elevation in the east-southeast direction.
The object then moved to 20 degrees in elevation in the east before suddenly disappearing.
The object's speed did not change during the observation.
The object was described as having a light-like color.
The report was considered unreliable by the investigators.
